comments: If you're interested at all in teaching in the future, the instructors of this course have a vast amount of knowledge about teaching, what works and what doesn't.

The class is not always easy, especially when you're getting feedback, but it will definitely be helpful if you are considering a career in teaching.  Even if you are not thinking about teaching after grad school, the skills learned in this class can benefit your presentation skills.

I think that I would describe it as a teaching workshop for someone who has an interest in teaching, preferably with a little bit of experience, rather than a straight 'how-to' on lesson construction.
It is like a reality show but it teaches you important teaching skills.
Excellently run course. it is a lot of fun and you will really improve your teaching skills.

This is a great course if you want to think about how we teach and how we learn, and if you want to practice teaching. It requires significant outside-of-class time to prepare your teaching samples, as well as to review other's work, but you get a lot out of it.

The focus of the class is not on rhetorical skills or test writing (although those are covered to some extent). Instead, emphasis is placed on how to get students to participate in discussion and how to promote retention of a small number of key concepts. You learn how to handle large lectures and small discussion groups, and the skills easily translate into mentoring new lab members.
It's a great class to learn the basics of teaching biology courses.

It`s a great learning experience. If you have never thought a class it will give you the basic, if you have experience it will refine your style and strengthen your delivery and planning. It`s also a great class if you just wanna improve your presentation skills.
Great way to get experience teaching in a comfortable environment.
some good opportunities along with some unproductive hassles
A great class if you are considering a career in teaching!

Be prepared to put in more time than you expect. I was very busy this semester so I didn't put in as much time as I should have, and I'm sure I didn't get as much out of the class because of this. It's a really great course and I highly recommend it for anyone who is interested in teaching. It will introduce you to a lot of new ideas you might not encounter on your own.
If you're interested in a teaching-oriented academic career, this would be a useful class to take, especially if you haven't yet been exposed to methodologies in teaching.
